column4: Problem with my clock.. it is 4hrs off and I can not change it..
man date
you have to set the date using the cli app date
did you try that?
I don't understand.. I am new.
alright I'll explain
to set the time you type this
sudo date MMDDHHMM
does that make sense?
Sort of..
example: date 07230755
But what caused it to change, and will it ever come around to sync with internet servers like I chose?
you have it set to sync with internet servers? How in the world did you do that?
are you dual booting with windows?
No, OSx
I don't know about OSX, but I do know that Windows doesn't play well with others...it will change your hardware clock to your local time
So that may have changed it, if you booted in to OSX
sorry i gotta run
take care

Well NOW i was able to change the time... just a couple of hours ago I wasn't.  All of the menus were not available to me.. They just weren't there.. If I choose "adjust date and time" prompted for password, it would fail.
I figured it had something to do with most of Ubuntu's servers being down.
